tweet_text: A hideous harbinger of the future if we are not careful
I wrote about this today on Conservative Home

Whilst the ECHR has an important role in dealing with terrorism MPs must have the final say on determining the law Independent courts national or international are enormously important but we should recognise that they do make mistakes as with Usman Khan.
Legal wrangling continues in the case brought by Loughinisland journalists Barry McCaffrey and Trevor Birney Hopefully we'll have a decision soon.
Police seem to have reacted with impressive speed to the London Bridge incident As they did last time.
I couldn‚Äôt agree more The whole Humber catchment area needs a new Vermuyden to find smart innovative solutions to flood management
The Drainage Association has written to party leaders today calling for a ‚Äústrategic catchment-based approach that considers wider benefits other than just ‚Äòcounting chimney pots.‚Äô‚Äù
@Marinosloizides also met some four-legged constituents
Had an excellent but rather wet day out in Brough I met a number of my constituents who I have helped over the years like @Marinosloizides
RT @andreajenkyns Another great day on the doorsteps talking to residents across #Morley &amp #Outwood üö™üó≥ Special thanks to the fantastic Ha‚Ä¶

I don‚Äôt normally take it upon myself to highlight the bogus ‚Äúfacts in @LibDems leaflets But in this case it is quite important that nobody believes the one at the end of this leaflet Just to be clear the General Election is on Thursday 12 December NOT Monday 2 December
The Haltemprice and Howden team had a great day out supporting @andreajenkyns The response on the doorstep was fantastic

Many congratulations to @HitachiRailEU and Trains on the arrival of the new Paragon Fleet It is terrific to see this level of investment in our railways I'm looking forward to my next trip it will be great to have a train as nice as the staff

Took some of the team to Grimsby yesterday for a wet day‚Äôs campaigning Was originally sceptical of the poll that gave us a 12 point lead there Not any more Virtually everybody I spoke to was voting Conservative
Guidance by the College of Policing needs immediate revision Police should not be investigating ‚Äúnon-crimes‚Äù Positively Orwellian.
Well worth reading Zoe Strimpel's article about oppression of free speech and ridiculous behaviour by various police forces including my own Humberside.
Really good interview of @CatharineHoey in today's Telegraph Highlights her courage.
The Chief Executive of @resfoundation confirming that under Labour manifesto commitments taxes would have to rise on the bottom 95 of earners
RT @DominicRaab I am relieved a number of orphaned children have arrived home safely from Syria We assess each case carefully and facili‚Ä¶
Good article in today‚Äôs Times on how Corbyn‚Äôs tax hikes do not bear scrutiny by @PJTheEconomist director of the independent thinktank @TheIFS.

.@jeremycorbyn claims that his taxes will fall solely on the rich In the last week a number of my working class constituents have spontaneously said that they believe his taxes will hit them After yesterday they have been proven right.

Excellent news about the return of the orphans @DominicRaab is right that these children are innocent of any crime But so are all the other British children in Syrian camps we should bring these home too ASAP before there are any more deaths

The US extradition request for Dr Mike Lynch comes at an extraordinarily inappropriate time as a verdict has yet to be reached in the civil case he is fighting here in the UK The British authorities should not countenance extradition at this time
In Cottingham Market with my team just met someone who wants us to do something about the unjust and retrospective loan charge I hope we will deal with this shortly after the election

Labour are very unwise to pledge to scrap right to buy It‚Äôs the most popular policy with working families It would not release any new houses because the vast majority of council tenants stay in their house for a long period

Today I met with Community Speed Watch Bubwith who monitor traffic through the village which is plagued with dangerous speeding vehicles They work alongside the police who send warnings to any offenders This is a great community-led initiative that I am proud to have helped
.@JeremyCorbyn says corporation tax rates back to 2010 levels We raised over 10 billion less in 2010 than we do now.
Good one-liner from @BorisJohnson Boris on social care Nobody should have to sell their home to pay for their care.
.@jeremycorbyn is ignoring the simple fact that Labour under Blair introduced more private sector involvement in the NHS than any other government.
RT @DavidDavisMP .@jeremycorbyn's attempt to suggest we seek to privatise the NHS fails completely before the Prime Minister's flat denial‚Ä¶
RT @BorisJohnson Our NHS will never be for sale #BackBoris #LeadersDebate
.@jeremycorbyn's attempt to suggest we seek to privatise the NHS fails completely before the Prime Minister's flat denial It's that simple.
.@jeremycorbyn Corbyn claims we got our deal through with the DUP's support this is wrong it passed second reading WITHOUT the DUP #LeadersDebate

Great news that Boris intends to cut employers NI and some other taxes The main effect will be on small companies who create more of the jobs and more of the growth in the economy than the big companies do
Brilliant article by @LiamHalligan in the Telegraph His new book "Home Truths looks well worth a read very similar to my own views and ideas on garden villages
Secondly I am not aware of other countries with an FTA like Japan or Korea paying for access!

.@jeremycorbyn said ‚ÄúIf you want access to a market there are costs involved in answer to a question about whether we should continue to pay an EU subscription Firstly their access to our market is bigger than ours to them so why should we pay?
@RobOz73 Thanks Rob I appreciate you letting me know Would you mind shooting me a brief email to campaign@daviddavis.uk with this info in so I can investigate?

We now have to learn the lessons and make the emergency measures unnecessary Would you do me a favour @RobOz73 and brief your local councillors on the detailed causes I will be pursuing all of these issues with the local authorities when we have the data to review Thanks.
Thanks Rob the local services did a magnificent job in numerous places as I saw for myself at Everthorpe I am very very glad they saved your house

Quick update as far as I can tell about 18 houses flooded this week That is 18 too many as it is absolutely miserable for families But it looks likely that the combination of millions spent on flood defences and the efforts of local authorities saved thousands more houses

I also visited the Market Weighton canal By Murphy's law the canal's lock had a problem only a couple of weeks ago But local drainage specialists fixed it just in time protecting a vast area of East Yorkshire from high tides
Today I was up at the lagoon at Willerby Carr to inspect the flood defenses there The lagoon is full and has probably saved thousands of households across the region from flooding
Good to see @grantshapps committing to reverse Beeching rail closures I launched a report from tpa on opening up a whole series of local railway lines and services some months ago Here is the report

So far fewer flood victims than I had feared but still miserable for those hit by the problem Council think they have found every one but if you have water ingress to your home call 01482 393939 They can help from sandbags to housing to a range of items of advice

Now Corbyn wants to nationalise broadband Sure we need more investment in broadband but we also need more competent provision Openreach is useless because it has too monopolistic a position It needs more competition not less State control will make it worse.
By the way the village community in Everthorpe are amazing in how they turned out to help the residents who were flooded Well done to all of them
There appear to be floods elsewhere but I won‚Äôt repeat until I am able to confirm My heart goes out to those facing these floods it‚Äôs always ever so grim in these situations.

The emergency services here in Haltemprice &amp Howden are working flat out but are facing a really tough situation There‚Äôs a perfect storm of saturated ground non-stop rain full dykes and high tide.
The biblical rains continue I‚Äôm currently at Everthorpe where some houses are beginning to flood Cllr Victoria Aitken is already here and the emergency services are doing a great job.
Checked out the water levels at one of the flood alert areas near me Welham Bridge over the River Foulness But this was before the hours of biblical rain we've had this afternoon..
.@LauraPidcockMP said on this morning‚Äôs @BBCr4today programme that immigrants were not to blame for wages being depressed Quite right It‚Äôs the policy‚Äôs fault very much not the same thing.

Diabetes U.K analysis shows obesity has almost doubled in the last 20 years This trend could cripple the NHS in a generation not to mention the misery it will cause through diabetes heart disease strokes and cancer See my article
I would like to see more investment in initiatives like the Advanced Manufacturing Centre
Excellent pledge by Boris to double r&d expenditure We need to reverse the trend under all governments of the last 50 years Just look at how we‚Äôve been left behind
Good article from The Times on this here

Fantastic that Nottingham Trent are reviewing the number of 1st Class Honours they award This grade inflation and the notorious unconditional offers were both encouraged by the terrible tuition fee/loan system I will continue to campaign for its reform.
Donald Tusk is unwise to ignore the convention of staying out of internal politics of member states Foreign leaders should stay out of our democratic decisions whether they are Obama Trump or Tusk.
@Marinosloizides Not sure just yet certainly within the next couple of weeks If you‚Äôd like to shoot me an email to campaign@daviddavis.uk I‚Äôm happy to let you know!
Great work guys I‚Äôm very lucky to have such a fantastic campaigning team
And can‚Äôt forget the inevitable dog photo..
Brilliant and sunny if chilly day on the campaign trail today with some of my team visiting constituents in Howden and Gilberdyke
Nice to see Farage is coming to my constituency to the same place where I was readopted three months ago He will find we‚Äôre all very welcoming in East Yorkshire
Good news for democracy The postal workers have every right to strike but not when it would hold our democracy to ransom
Good to see unemployment going down for the fastest quarterly rate in several years
.@john4brexit the Brexit Party MEP has a good piece on why Boris deal is a good one and can lead to a Canada outcome.

Lord Berkeley is right that it's been clear for a long time there has been a massive underestimate of the cost of HS2 It's ridiculous to suggest it should go ahead despite the spiralling cost There are many other things the money could be spent on.
Wrong decision again to carry on with HS2 It‚Äôs time to scrap this white elephant and invest in more useful local infrastructure from rail to broadband
A tragedy that the last years of his life were blighted by the disgraceful Operation Midland This makes it all the more important that we fix these weaknesses in our policing.
Very sad that the great and gallant Field Marshal Bramall has died My condolences to his whole family for their loss he was a very great man.
Cold wet day on the streets but reception still very good and we‚Äôve found our mascot for the election
Although there are bits of flooding around my constituency we‚Äôve thankfully not been hit as hard as elsewhere in the area My thoughts go to those affected.
I think I also may have met half of Haltemprice and Howden‚Äôs canine population
Some fantastic responses today from constituents on the success of our Transwaste appeal My team and I enjoyed a great lunch at The Green Dragon in Welton
Away from politics a great visit to a young entrepreneur @NFireLabs A start-up company offering bespoke 3-D design and printing at an amazingly good price
Great morning campaigning Response on the street has been excellent Thankfully the weather has improved

The ISC report on any Russian influence in our democracy should be published To not do so risks creating a paranoid vacuum that'll only damage the institutions we hold dear I told the minister as much earlier today

The health and lives of British children in Syria are at risk if we wait any longer to bring them home I again asked the Foreign Secretary @DominicRaab to do just that The Government must solve this problem before there is a fatality
Very significant that the @ICOnews says "police forces need to slow down and justify the use of live facial recognition technology I completely agree It is time for Parliament to debate this.

The Government has taken a very progressive view on the use of genomics But often the symptoms of genetic diseases do not manifest themselves until the developmental damage has been done So today I urged@Jochurchill4 to look at genetic testing for all newborns in the future

Interesting open minded response from @MattHancock on cannabis This is a serious and urgent issue for children with intractable epilepsy I think there is an argument for immediate controlled trials at a leading children's hospital @GreatOrmondSt PhilippaW
I welcome the Government's generous approach to child refugees in Europe I hope they will show the same generosity to British child refugees in Syria
This is particularly strange given the sugar tax is a major part of @DHSCgovuk's childhood obesity plan
Interesting to learn that uk has not made an assessment of the impact of the sugar tax on consumption

The 60 British children caught in the violence in north-east Syria must be repatriated If we to do nothing we will see these children again But it will not be as functioning members of society It will be as our enemy on the battlefields of the future
RT @lowcarbGP In Westminster today with @DavidDavisMP discussing fatty liver and type 2 diabetes Also How starchy carbs are ‚Äòsoon to be su‚Ä¶
RT @CentralLobby NEW Police conduct towards investigative journalists seeking to expose the truth of what happened at the Loughinisland m‚Ä¶
Watch the full debate here

Here is the story of TheDetail and @TrevorBirney two journalists who were arrested for exposing incompetence and collusion in the investigation of the Loughinisland massacre a brutal sectarian attack during the Northern Irish Troubles
Great to see John Humphrys back in play Might even see Classic FM listenership increase at expense of Radio 4
.@michaelgove is absolutely correct @SteveBakerHW did some brilliant work at DExEU supported by some fantastic civil servants
Good luck to my former press SpAd @TEMSmith who is running 3 marathons in 3 days Clearly a year working on Brexit was not tough enough He's raising money for a very good cause @theCALMzone
@AWMurrison Here is the response from @AWMurrison

The geopolitical disaster in Syria has left at least 60 British children there through no fault of their own in need of the Government's help Today I asked @AWMurrison not to abandon our moral obligations and to repatriate these vulnerable children before it's too late

Earlier today I asked @KellyTolhurst about executive pay The Government thinks there is no link between the use of share buyback and executive underperformance Maybe they should look at this Poland study
.@EmmaHardyMP asked a good question about BAE Brough today We are going to see the Minister @annietrev to discuss the issue on Wednesday.
Today I asked @MarkLancasterMK what the Ministry of Defence is doing to increase the recruitment of service personnel and to ensure they are fit for deployment
During the referendum Parliament effectively made a promise to the British people to deliver on their decision Today is the day to deliver on that promise and vote the deal through
I also spoke on @BBCr4today programme on Britain's trade opportunities after we leave the EU
Here are my three criteria for an acceptable deal for Northern Ireland: 1 Do not break up the union 2 Equal Advantage for Northern Ireland when leaving the EU 3.Maintain democratic rights

Victims of domestic violence experience terror and fear when their assailants are released from prison Today I urge @patel4witham to look at extending restriction on those criminals possibly for life to better protect victims

Following my intervention on returning foreign fighters to face justice and rescuing their families from becoming future terrorists J_Harper &amp @Jamie4North backed me up The Foreign Secretary said he would take on board our concerns and keep the situation under review

The escape of Daesh prisoners in northern Syria is a threat to western society I urged @DominicRaab to work with colleagues to return terrorists and their families to face justice and ensure their children are not brought up in an environment which will turn them into terrorists
Harrowing piece on the recent suicides linked to the Loan Charge This punitive retrospective tax must be scrapped
Here is my letter to @patel4witham

After the Chief Magistrate who issued search warrants in Operation Midland agreed with the Henriques report's criticism of the police it looks inevitable there will have to be a criminal investigation of police conduct I will write to the Home Secretary

When violent criminals are released it is a time of fear and sometimes terror for their victims Today I asked @RobertBuckland what more can be done to protect victims beyond the licence period of their abusers
There is a growing impetus behind the restriction of both private and public use of facial recognition cameras in US towns

The UK‚Äôs constitution has worked for hundreds of years but faced with a number of challenges including Brexit it is close to failure We now need a full-scale written constitution to rebalance our nation‚Äôs decision-making.

The tragedy of the Loan Charge is that seven people have taken their own lives because of the pressure and stress caused If Ministers do not end the use of this punitive retrospective taxation the Commons will force it to
Finally investment in hospitals is excellent and it should be publicly financed NOT through PFI This is possible when interests rates are so low.
The investment in "on demand bus services is good This could be fantastic for low-density rural areas.
.@SajidJavid is right infrastructure investment IS key to Britain's future success Investment in extending high-speed broadband to the most remote areas of the country is long overdue.
Yesterday I went to meet with Sir Amyas Morse who is heading up the independent inquiry into the Loan Charge scandal I am impressed at how seriously he and his team appear to be taking it.
I have signed the @loanchargeAPPG's open letter to the Chancellor It is critical that all activity related to this unfair retrospective tax is suspended while Sir Amyas Morse conducts his review

The unfettered and unregulated growth of the surveillance state continues with the rollout of live facial recognition cameras across Britain This must be halted now so Parliament can debate and regulate it properly

The future of medical research lies in big data But we must ensure ultra-sensitive healthcare data remains private In today's @Telegraph I outline how we can build on the extraordinary position we already enjoy in physiological research and genomics

We need a proper legal framework fit for these emerging technologies to balance policing effectiveness and privacy Parliament must have the chance to debate it properly and establish proper rules for the police to follow An immediate halt would allow the time for that debate.

Today I along with colleagues from across the House sign @bbw1984's pledge calling on UK police &amp companies to immediately halt the use of facial recognition cameras The unregulated use of such systems is potentially a serious invasion of individual privacy and civil liberties
The answer is greater personal responsibility and laws encouraging producers to reformulate food to make it healthier on the basis of the latest science
I am opposed to the nanny state But the epidemic of dietary diseases will see the cost of the NHS double in a generation.
The common sense next step for @HMRCgovuk is to freeze all action and defer all deadlines until the end of the year.

Excellent news there is to be an independent review into the Loan Charge Sir Amyas Morse is principled and highly respected As the head of the review I trust him to put an end to this unfair retrospective taxation once and for all
A pleasure to open Training‚Äôs fantastic new facility in Holme-on-Spalding-Moor An excellent local success story

Disappointing decision by the courts With 55 per cent of people wanting restrictions imposed on the use of this controversial technology it is time Parliament had a definitive say on the use of such systems
Today I spoke at the Loan Charge demonstration outside of Parliament It is time this unjust policy is cancelled

The Chancellor has today confirmed an extra ¬£750 million will be made available to recruit additional police officers across the UK This means safer communities throughout Yorkshire and more officers for @Humberbeat
Today's confirmation that primary schools will receive guaranteed funding of ¬£3,750 per pupil in 2020-21 is an excellent first step
I suspect this will not be the last time we see headlines about HS2 being further delayed and billions overbudget The recently announced review into the project must scrap this white elephant
This is the right decision but it is only the start of a wider debate on the use of facial recognition technology and the implications for civil liberties.

I have consistently argued that a Brexit deal will not be sealed until the final few weeks leading up to 31 October Attempts to block no deal only serve to weaken the UK's negotiating hand at this critical time and reduce the likelihood of a deal

If we do not get a handle on antibiotic resistance and if this gets out of control even going to hospital could be potentially life-threatening AMR has the potential to make the great flu epidemic look like a mere cold.

Dame Sally Davies is absolutely right AMR is the most immediate threat to humankind We should not forget that this year is the 100th anniversary of the 1918 Influenza epidemic which in one year killed at least three times as many people as WW1 did in total
The rest of my interview on the @BBCR4Today programme can be heard here
Good to visit @BBCR4Today this morning to talk about no deal preparation We must remember that Yellowhammer is a worst-case scenario drafted by those predisposed to pessimism
My recommendation to the independent review of HS2 is to scrap this colossal waste of money Here's why:

Fantastic to hear that there will be an independent review into whether to proceed with HS2 It's time to cancel this white elephant and spend money where it will have the most impact across the country.
It is time @ukhomeoffice brought proposals to Parliament to regulate this technology and set proper standards of use both for the private sector and police forces up and down the country.

This is yet another demonstration of the pressing need to regulate facial recognition tech The use of this by private companies with no clear oversight or accountability is a serious intrusion on the privacy of citizens going about their everyday lives

The roll out of handheld facial recognition devices is completely unacceptable whilst the technology is subject to an ongoing legal challenge It‚Äôs time for a moratorium on the use of such cameras so we can better understand the risks and limitations
RT @libertyhq "#FacialRecognition is very different to CCTV because it takes your biometric data and makes a map of your face that can be‚Ä¶

The Ashes Trust Playing Field in Howden is in the running for the @FieldsinTrust Best Park 2019 award Cast your vote here to nominate this fantastic green space at the heart of the local community #LoveYourLocalPark
It's time for the new PM @BorisJohnson to instruct @sajidjavid to scrap the unfair Loan Charge a retrospective tax which is thought to have led to suicides

422,000 European jobs are at risk from a "no deal scenario It's still likely that the Commission will return to the negotiating table though this may happen shortly after Brexit as they still hope Parliament will stop "no deal.
What a pity to hear of @PennyMordaunt's resignation She would've been a fantastic Secretary of State.

The allegation that the police have used intrusive surveillance techniques on journalists is worrying We urgently need a new Official Secrets Act and we need an explicit statutory protection for journalists acting in the public interest.

Today the Government announced it will not establish an independent judge-led inquiry into the UK's complicity in torture overseas The Government is asking us to allow it to mark its own homework This is not good enough and it will be challenged in the courts

Today the @CommonsSTC launched their report on the forensic &amp biometric strategy This is a good report and I wholeheartedly agree with their call for a moratorium on the use of live facial recognition technology until a proper regulatory framework is established

There have been reports of the @metpoliceuk using intrusive surveillance techniques on journalists to track down the source of diplomatic leaks Today I asked @NickHurdUK to reassure the House this is not the case The Government must do all it can to protect press freedom
I'll shortly be appearing on @BBCRadio2 discussing my granddaughter and our family's fight with the rare genetic condition Syngap1

Today I gave @DLidington notice that if the Government does not establish an independent judge-led inquiry into the UK's complicity in rendition and torture I will seek legal advice on whether it is in breach of human rights law

Additional work is secured for the site so there will be no compulsory redundancies in 2019 BAE are also retraining employees for design &amp engineering roles created at the site The Government and BAE must continue doing all they can to secure the long-term future of BAE Brough

Today I had a constructive meeting with @StuartAndrew to discuss the Kuwaiti Government's disappointing decision to end interest in buying Hawk aircraft from @BAESystemsplc in Brough The Minister has committed to doing everything possible to help BAE.
If you would like to support the Patrick Wild Centre's research into SYNGAP1 like that which afflicts my granddaughter please click below.
I sat down with The @DailyMailUK last week to talk about my granddaughter and our family's fight with a rare genetic condition.
RT @rowlsmanthorpe The MP who's leading on this is @DavidDavisMP This was what he said in response to those comments You shouldn't belie‚Ä¶
RT @rowlsmanthorpe NEW (and I promise this really happened) The head of the Metropolitan Police Federation said China‚Äôs facial recognitio‚Ä¶

This is a damning evaluation of live facial recognition cameras These trials must be suspended until parliament has had the chance to properly debate the issues and establish a clear regulatory framework.
RT @SkyNewsTech Conservative MP David Davis says the decision to use facial recognition should not be down to the police. A study by the‚Ä¶
RT @SkyNewsTech David Davis MP says that he believes that Boris Johnson would "understand the risk of police facial recognition technolog‚Ä¶

Today I asked Norman what impact @hmtreasury believes the Loan Charge is having on people's mental health It's time the Treasury takes seriously the impact this policy is having on those ordinary citizens affected and scrap the retrospective Loan Charge altogether
I am backing @BorisJohnson because he will deliver Brexit unite our Party and then defeat Jeremy Corbyn It‚Äôs as straightforward as that.

Delighted to congratulate J Rotherham @cambridgehok and Yorkare Homes on making it into @LSEGplc ‚Äò1000 companies to inspire Britain‚Äô Together they have created almost 250 new jobs in Haltemprice and Howden The economy is thriving in Yorkshire and the Humber

Glad to hear the @ChtyCommission has withdrawn the official warning against the @iealondon It was a wholly inappropriate case against them and would have resulted in a chilling effect on the entire thinktank sector hindering bold thinking and the creation of new ideas.
I and colleagues from the @loanchargeAPPG call on @BorisJohnson and Hunt to sign the pledge to suspend the Loan Charge and order a proper review
Last week I wrote for The Telegraph on the risk live facial recognition technology poses to civil liberties in the UK
I agree with him that a clear and specific legal framework must be put in place to govern the use of such technology
Important report today from the Biometrics Commissioner He is right to highlight the risks to privacy that live facial recognition technology poses.

Yesterday I had a great meeting with @NickHurdUK on the use of live facial recognition technology The Minister is seized of the need to get this right by properly protecting us from criminals and terrorists whilst also ensuring the privacy of ordinary citizens is safeguarded.
This week is National School Sport Week which is focusing on five ways to wellbeing To read more see here #NSSW @YouthSportTrust
I hope @johnprescott recovers completely from this stroke My thoughts are with him and his family.
RT @DetentionAction In a busy week full of politics @DavidDavisMP talked to us about why he thinks indefinite immigration detention is a‚Ä¶

Live facial recognition cameras have the potential to erode civil liberties in the UK for little gain and some risk It is time for a moratorium on the use of the cameras so that we can better understand the risks and limitations of such technology

Good to see Guernsey Jersey and Isle of Man acknowledge the need for public registers of beneficial ownership This means greater transparency &amp less tax evasion However concerns remain particularly on timing These must be addressed before we can endorse their proposals.
He is the clear winner of this debate He has set out an impressive and optimistic vision for both Brexit and Britain‚Äôs future @DominicRaab is the man to deliver it #C4Debate
.@DominicRaab is the only candidate who has committed to leaving in October no matter what He is the only one with first-hand experience of negotiating with the European Union #C4Debate
Cutting taxes for the lowest income amongst us boosting apprenticeships building homes and ensuring people have a stake in our society This is a great vision for our future from @DominicRaab.
It‚Äôs clear that @DominicRaab is the only one who is determined to do what is necessary to leave in October as the majority of the people want #C4Debate
.@DominicRaab is entirely right all options must be kept on the table to secure the best possible deal come October #C4Debate
.@DominicRaab is absolutely the right man to make a success of Brexit that is why I am supporting him for leader of the Conservative Party

The new leader's mandate will only be as strong as the clarity of his message and so it is very important that everyone takes part in the debates starting with @Channel4News this Sunday before the next vote and then @BBCNews next Tuesday.
I'm backing @DominicRaab for leader of the Conservative Party and our Prime Minister He is the man to deliver on the opportunities Brexit presents and lead the party to electoral success

Today I met with @StuartAndrew to ensure the need to secure future orders for the BAE Hawk aircraft remains at the top of the Government's agenda He assured me every effort is being made to create new orders as soon as possible
Last week I went to the fantastic #MangaExhibition at the @britishmuseum It is incredibly interesting and everyone should go
I suspect the @BBC's decision will face a legal challenge in due course They will likely lose this thereby wasting more taxpayers money.
Very poor practice by the @BBC to withdraw free TV licences for over-75s In 2015 they agreed to take responsibility for this from 2020 They should now honour that commitment.

The Met's deployment of facial recognition technology resulted in a misidentification rate of over 90% I am glad that Policing Minister @NickHurdUK has committed to carrying out urgent work to review how this technology is used

The decision to drop the case against Loughinisland journalists @trevorbirney and Barry McCaffrey was a momentous day for press freedom The PSNI must now deliver justice for the Loughinisland victims and their families

In March I wrote for @Telegraph on how S.60 stop and search powers are precisely the targeted powers necessary to cope with an epidemic of knife violence Pleased to see the increase used of these powers is now having an effect.

PSNI have now dropped the case against @trevorbirney and Barry McCaffrey An outstanding victory for Press Freedom My congratulations to two brave journalists and their fantastic team Now for justice for Loughinisland.

Everyone should condemn in the strongest terms the cowardly &amp irresponsible attack on the PSNI officer The people of Northern Ireland want no return to the cruelty and violence of the past and simply want to live their lives in peace
For the second time this week I'm in Belfast supporting journalists Barry McCaffrey and @trevorbirney in their fight against attempts to undermine the freedom of the press
Philip Augar's review on student fees is a good start but it needs to be the beginning of a radical overhaul of the Higher Education system
I also wrote about the use of torture in today's Times Torture is wrong both in principle and in law it endangers serving soldiers and it simply does not work

Following troubling news today that Government policy could allow cooperation with torture if "the potential benefits justify accepting the risk and the legal consequences" I asked @PennyMordaunt to make a statement
If the Government wants to help the North it has to build railways in the North.
Good report on HS2 by the House of Lords Economic Affairs Committee As they say too much emphasis has been put on cutting journey times and not enough on the economic benefits for the regions
Very important the Government listens to personal stories like this The retrospective Loan Charge is causing a huge amount of stress to tens of thousands of people It needs to be scrapped now
HS2 will not deliver on its stated aims Now is the time to scrap this vanity project and focus on infrastructure that will benefit all areas of the UK
RT @GregHands 13 ex-Cabinet &amp Sir Graham Brady letter to the PM ‚ÄúA Customs Union Brexit deal with Labour is both bad policy and bad polit‚Ä¶

It was a pleasure to launch a report today from tpa proposing 28 great alternatives to HS2 It's time the Government scrapped HS2 and focused on investments that will genuinely boost regional growth and improve connectivity

The Disability Living Allowance appeal process is broken It is causing deprivation and distress to young lives including that of my eight-year-old constituent Jessica I asked the Secretary of State for Work &amp Pensions to address this as quickly as possible

The next PM must recognise HS2 for the wasteful vanity project it really is The money could be better spent on regional infrastructure fibre-optic broadband fixing the housing crisis or funding any number of more worthwhile infrastructure projects

Insightful speech this morning on the rise of populism by my erstwhile Cabinet colleague @DavidGauke However we must face up to the fact that we in the establishment got it wrong in 2008.. and now we are reaping the consequences @ukonward #GaukePopulism

Indefinite detention of migrants is an important issue from a civil liberties standpoint But this report shows it also costs as much as ¬£35m a year This Government must change course on this when the Immigration Bill comes back to Parliament
Delays to the granting of probate are absolutely unacceptable The government is causing undue stress to grieving families This needs to be sorted quickly

The local election results show the public are fed up with politicians failing to deliver Brexit The way forward is to go back to the EU and give it one last chance renegotiate an acceptable deal or leave calmly and speedily without a deal

I will be backing @DominicRaab in the forthcoming Conservative leadership contest His unique combination of intellect determination decisiveness and courage means he is the best placed candidate to deliver on the opportunities Brexit presents
A few months ago I wrote about this and related issues in The Times.
This is a move in the right direction on what must be done to protect consumers buying smart home technology However it is only the first step much will need to be done on this issue
Fantastic news that North Ferriby will once again be home to a football team There is a long history of football in the area and I hope North Ferriby Football Club go on to enjoy great success

Tonight I gave the 5th Margaret Thatcher Lecture I spoke of the lessons we can learn from her today How would she tackle the issues of the day social mobility policing housing tuition fees and welfare @Conservatives must rediscover our ambition for meritocracy.

I have urged the Prime Minister to go to Brussels and push for a time-limited Northern Ireland backstop As it stands the Withdrawal Agreement hands all the negotiating power to the EU It fails to take back control of our laws our borders or our money.
We need a new strategy of hope vision and imagination Next Tuesday is make or break it‚Äôs time to defeat this wretched deal and get on with the future

The Conservative Party has a key role in this That role is not to attempt to bully MPs into support for a failed strategy Our role is to come together to find a joint approach that supports the decision of the referendum and promotes the national interest.
To do this we need to preserve our freedom of action on trade on regulations on migration on fishing We must not subordinate ourselves to partisan foreign institutions Democracy demands no less.
We will be judged in the future as to whether we flinched in the face of unfounded threats and panic or stood up for our national interest and took our proper place in the world.

It is a common clich of political speeches that we stand at a turning point in history For once however it is true The decisions taken in the next few months will dictate our nation's future for a generation.
